Name: Tunic ornaments
Description: The decoration on this tunic consists of a large pectoral, broad vertical bands and two square shoulder insets on the front and on the back. It is executed in purple-brown wool and undyed linen [flax] tapestry on a fabric of undyed linen. The patterns were formed by an additional thread, the flying shuttle (the so-called "flying needle" technique). The pectorals are decorated with dancing figures and musicians and there are animal and floral designs on the bands. All of these motifs follow the Hellenistic tradition.
